source_sentence: 沙彌答言：『有。』
translation: The novice replied, 'Yes.'

source_sentence: 『若有者更將三十二人來。』
translation: 'If there are, I'll bring thirty-two more.'

source_sentence: 如是漸增乃至六萬。
translation: It gradually increases in this way up to 60,000.

source_sentence: 是時外道六萬徒眾失供養分。
translation: At the time, 60,000 non-Buddhist disciples lost the portion of their offerings.

source_sentence: 大德泥瞿陀即授王及宮內夫人諸臣，悉受三歸五戒。
translation: The great virtuous Nirgrantha then bestowed the three refuges and five precepts on the king and his palace ladies and ministers, who all received the three refuges and five precepts.

source_sentence: 是時王及諸人信心倍增，無有退轉。
translation: At the time, the king and his people's faith doubled, and there was no turning back.

source_sentence: 王為諸眾僧，起立大寺安處眾僧，乃至六萬日日供養。
translation: For the sake of the monks, the king built a large temple for them and placed it there to serve as an offering for 60,000 days.

source_sentence: 王所統領八萬四千國王，勅諸國起八萬四千大寺，起塔八萬四千，王勅諸國造立塔寺，各受王命歡喜而造。
translation: The king ruled over eighty-four thousand kingdoms and ordered the countries to build eighty-four thousand great temples and eighty-four thousand stūpas, and the king ordered the countries to build stupas and monasteries, each rejoicing in receiving the king's order.

source_sentence: 「復有一日於阿育僧伽藍作大布施，布施已，王於六萬比丘僧中坐，而作是言：『我有四種供給，湯藥、飲食、衣服、臥具，自恣與僧。』
translation: Again, there was another day when he made a great gift to the 60,000 monks and nuns of Aśoka Monastery, and after making the gift, the king sat among the 60,000 monks and nuns and said, 'I have four kinds of offerings, namely, hot water, medicine, food, clothing, bedding, and self-reliance for the saṃgha.'

source_sentence: 語已而作是問：『諸大德！
translation: After he said this, he asked, 'O great virtuous ones!

source_sentence: 佛所統領有幾種法耶？』
translation: How many kinds of dharmas are there that are led by the Buddha?'

source_sentence: 比丘答言：『支法有九，法聚有八萬四千。』
translation: The monks replied, 'There are nine factors of the Dharma, and there are 84,000 dharmas in the Dharma group.'

source_sentence: 王聞已，至心於法。
translation: Having heard this, the king paid close attention to the Dharma.

source_sentence: 王作是念：『我當立八萬四千寺，以供養八萬四千法聚。』
translation: The king thought, 'Should I establish 84,000 temples to make offerings to 84,000 dharmas?'

source_sentence: 即日出銀錢九十六億，而喚大臣。
translation: On that day, he produced ninety-six billion pieces of silver coin and summoned the minister.

source_sentence: 臣到已，王語臣言：『我所領八萬四千國，遣人宣令，國起一寺。』
translation: When the minister arrived, the king said to his ministers, 'I'll govern 84,000 countries and send someone to declare that a temple will be built in my country.'

source_sentence: 阿育王自作阿育王僧伽藍。
translation: King Aśoka himself made the monastic monastery of King Aśoka.

source_sentence: 「眾僧見阿育王欲起大寺，見已有一比丘，名因陀掘多，有大神力漏盡羅漢。
translation: When the saṃgha saw that King Aśoka wanted to build a large temple, they saw that there was already a monk named Indragupta with great supernormal powers who had ended the contaminants of the arhat.

source_sentence: 眾僧即差因陀掘多，統知寺事。
translation: The monks then sent Indragupta to supervise the affairs of the monastery.

source_sentence: 是時因陀掘多見寺有所闕短處，自以神力修治令辦，王出銀錢，羅漢神力三年乃成。
translation: When Indragupta saw that there was something missing in the monastery, he cultivated it with his own supernatural powers to make it possible for him to do so. The king produced silver coins and the temple was completed in three years by the supernatural powers of the arhat.

source_sentence: 諸國起寺來啟答王，一日俱到，白統臣言：『造塔寺已成。』
translation: The kings of the countries built temples and came to answer the questions, and when they arrived one day, they all said to the emperor, 'The stūpa has been completed.'

source_sentence: 統臣入白王言：『八萬四千國，起八萬四千寺塔，皆悉已成。』
translation: The ruler's ministers went in and said to the king, 'Eighty-four thousand countries built 84,000 temples and stūpas have all been completed.'

source_sentence: 王答言：『善哉！』
translation: The king answered, 'Good!'

source_sentence: 王語一大臣：『可打鼓宣令，寺塔已成，七日之後當大供養布施，國中一切內外人民，悉受八戒身心清淨。』
translation: The king said to one of his ministers, 'You may beat the drum and proclaim that the temple's stūpa has been completed, that seven days from now you will make great offerings and give alms, and that all the people inside and outside the country will receive the eight precepts so that their bodies and minds are pure.'

source_sentence: 過七日已，莊嚴擬赴王命，如天帝釋諸天圍遶，阿育王國土亦復如是，莊嚴竟，人民遊觀無有厭足，人民悉入寺舍。
translation: After seven days had passed, the adornments were prepared to go to the king's orders, just as Indra and the gods surrounded him with goddesses, so was the kingdom of King Aśoka's land when the adornments were completed, where the people traveled and observed without tire, and all the people entered the monastery.

source_sentence: 「爾時集眾，有八億比丘僧、九十六萬比丘尼，於集眾中羅漢一萬。
translation: At the time, there were 800 million monks and 960,000 bhikṣus and nuns in the assembly, and 10,000 arhats in the assembly.

source_sentence: 諸比丘僧心作是念：『我當以神通力令王得見己所造功德，見此已然後佛法大盛。』
translation: The monks and nuns thought, 'Should I use my supernormal powers to cause the king to see the merit he's created so that after seeing this, the Buddha's teaching will flourish?'

source_sentence: 諸比丘以神通力，王所統領閻浮利地，縱廣四萬乃至海際，其中所起塔寺，一切供養布施種種功德，使王一時覩見。
translation: Because of their supernormal powers, the monks led the king's command over Jambudvīpa, which was 40,000 miles long and 40,000 miles wide up to the limit of the sea, where they built stūpas and temples that were all offered as offerings and various merits, causing the king to see them at once.

source_sentence: 王得見已心中歡喜，而白眾僧言：『如我今者，供養如來作大布施，心中歡喜有如我不？』
translation: When the king saw this, he rejoiced in his heart and said to the saṃgha, 'Such as I am now, offering support to the Tathāgata makes a great gift, and my heart rejoices with such-and-such self?'

source_sentence: 於是眾僧，推目揵連子帝須令答王。
translation: The saṃgha then asked Maudgalyāyana, the prince of Mūryamuni, to answer the king.

source_sentence: 帝須答王言：『佛在世時諸人供養，不及於王，唯王一人無能過者。』
translation: The emperor answered the king, saying, 'When the Buddha was in the world, all the people who offered support to him weren't as good as the king, except for the king alone, who couldn't surpass him.'

source_sentence: 「王聞帝須此語，心中歡喜不斷，而作念言：『於佛法中作大布施，無與我等，我當受持佛法如子愛父，則無有狐疑。』
translation: When the king heard these words, he didn't stop rejoicing in his heart and thought, 'If you make a great gift of the Buddha's teaching but don't give it to us, then I will uphold the Buddha's teaching like a son who loves his father, so there won't be any doubt.'

source_sentence: 於是大王問比丘僧：『我於佛法中得受持不？』
translation: The great king then asked the monks and nuns, 'Did I receive and uphold the Buddha's teaching?'

source_sentence: 爾時帝須聞王語已，又見王邊王子，名摩哂陀，因緣具足，便作念：『若是王子得出家者，佛法極大興隆。』
translation: After hearing what the emperor had said, he also saw a prince by the king's side named Mahāprajāpaṇḍa, whose causes and conditions were complete, and he thought, 'If this prince leaves home, the Buddha's teaching will flourish so greatly.'

source_sentence: 念已而白王言：『大王！
translation: After he thought this, he said to the king, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 如此功德猶未入佛法，譬如有人從地積七寶上至梵天，以用布施，於佛法中亦未得入，況王布施而望得入！』
translation: Such merit still hasn't entered the Buddha's teaching, so it's like a person who accumulates seven treasures from the earth up to Brahmā Heaven and uses them to give alms, but they haven't yet entered the Buddha's teaching, so why wouldn't the king hope to enter because he gives alms?'

source_sentence: 王復問言：『云何得入法分？』
translation: The king again asked, 'How can you enter the Dharma part?'

source_sentence: 帝須答言：『若貧若富，身自生子，令子出家得入佛法。』
translation: The emperor must answer, 'If you're poor or wealthy, give birth to your own child so that he leaves home and enters the Buddha's teaching.'

source_sentence: 作是言已，王自念：『我如此布施，猶未入佛法，我今當求得入因緣。』
translation: After he said this, the king thought to himself, 'Such a gift of mine hasn't yet entered the Buddha's teaching; now I will seek the causes and conditions for entering it.'

source_sentence: 「王觀看左右見摩哂陀，而作是念：『我弟帝須已自出家。』
translation: The king looked around to see Mahāprajāpa and thought, 'My younger brother Indra must have left home himself.'

source_sentence: 即立摩哂陀為大子，王復籌量立為太子好？
translation: He then appointed Mahāprajāpa as the prince, and the king again considered him to be the prince's goodness.

source_sentence: 令出家好？
translation: It's good for causing someone to leave home?

source_sentence: 即語摩哂陀：『汝樂出家不？』
translation: He then said to Mahāprajāpatī, 'Are you happy to leave home?'

source_sentence: 摩哂陀見叔帝須出家後，心願出家，聞王此言心大歡喜，即答：『實樂出家。
translation: When Mahāprajāpa saw that Śubhavyūha had to leave home, he wished to leave home. Hearing these words of the king, Mahāprajāpaṇḍa was greatly delighted and answered, 'It's really pleasant to leave home.

source_sentence: 若我出家，王於佛法得入法分。』
translation: If I leave home, the king will attain the entry into the Dharma aspect of the Buddha's teaching.'

source_sentence: 爾時王女名僧伽蜜多，立近兄邊，其婿先已與帝須俱出家。
translation: It was then that the king's daughter named Saṃghāmitra stood near her brother, whose son-in-law had previously left home with Tissa.

source_sentence: 王問僧伽蜜多：『汝樂出家不？』
translation: The king asked Saṃghamitta, 'Are you happy to leave home?'

source_sentence: 答言：『實樂。』
translation: He replied, 'It's really pleasant.'

source_sentence: 王答：『若汝出家大善。』
translation: The king answered, 'If you leave home, it's great and good.'

source_sentence: 王知其心，心中歡喜向比丘言：『大德！
translation: Knowing his mind, the king rejoiced in his heart and said to the monk, 'O great virtuous one!

source_sentence: 我此二子，眾僧為度，令我得入佛法。』
translation: These two sons of mine are saved by the saṃgha, so that I can enter the Buddha's teaching.'

source_sentence: 善見律毘婆沙卷第一
translation: Shanjian lu vibhāṣa, vol. 1
